member.name: M:NDoc.Core.Reflection.ReflectionEngine.CheckForPropertyBacker(System.Xml.XmlWriter,System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: This checks whether a field is a property backer, meaning it stores the information for the property.
member.remarks:
This takes advantage of the fact that most people have a simple convention for the names of the fields and the properties that they back. If the field doesn't have a summary already, and it looks like it backs a property, and the BaseDocumenterConfig property is set appropriately, then this adds a summary indicating that.
Note that this design will call multiple fields the backer for a single property.
This also will call a public field a backer for a property, when typically that wouldn't be the case.
member.param: The full name of the field.
The Type which contains the field and potentially the property.
member.returns: True only if a property backer is auto-documented.

member.name: M:NDoc.Core.Reflection.ReflectionEngine.FindProperty(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Find a particular property of the specified type, by name. Return the PropertyInfo for it.
member.param: The name of the property to find.
The type in which to search for the property.
member.returns: PropertyInfo - The property info, or null for not found.

member.name: M:NDoc.Core.Reflection.ReflectionEngine.WritePropertyBackerDocumentation(System.Xml.XmlWriter,System.String,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Write xml info for a property's backer field to the specified writer. This writes a string with a link to the property.
member.param: The field which backs the property.
The property backed by the field.

member.name: F:NDoc.Core.Reflection.AssemblyLoader.AssemblyNameFileNameMap
member.summary: assemblies already scanned, but not loaded.
member.remarks:
Maps Assembly FullName to Filename for assemblies scanned, but not loaded because they were not a match to the required FullName.
This list is scanned twice,
If the requested assembly has not been loaded, but is in this list, then the file is loaded. Once all search paths have been exhausted in an exact name match, this list is checked for a 'partial' match.

member.remarks: Property name matching is case-insensitive.

member.name: M:NDoc.Core.BaseDocumenterConfig.Write(System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Writes the current state of the config to the specified .
member.remarks:
This method uses reflection to serialize the public properties in the config.
A property will not be persisted if,
The value is equal to the default value, or
The string representation of the value is an empty string, or
The property has a Browsable(false) attribute, or
The property has a NonPersisted attribute.

member.name: M:NDoc.Core.BaseDocumenterConfig.Read(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Loads config details from the specified .
member.remarks: Each property found in the XML is loaded into current config using .

member.summary: Sets the value of a named property.
member.param: A string respesentation of the desired property value.
member.returns: A string containing any messages generated while attempting to set the property.

member.name: M:NDoc.Core.BaseDocumenterConfig.HandleUnknownPropertyType(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, handles a property found by which does not correspond to any property in the config object.
member.param: A string representation of the desired property value.
member.returns: A string containing any messages generated by the handler.
member.remarks:
As implemented in this class, no action is taken.
If a handler can translate the unknown property, it can call the protected method to process to translated name/value.

member.name: M:NDoc.Core.BaseDocumenterConfig.HandleUnknownPropertyValue(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, handles a unknown or invalid property value read by .
member.param: A string representation of the desired property value.
member.returns: A string containing any messages generated by the handler.
member.remarks:
As implemented in this class, an error message is returned which details the property name, type and the invalid value.
If a handler can translate the unknown value, it can call the protected method to process to translated name/value.

member.name: T:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig
member.summary: The base config class for documenters which use the to extract documentation from .Net assemblies.

remarks.para:
Generating the documentation consists of two high level steps:
Merging the /doc XML summary with reflected meta-data from the assemblies.
Transforming that merged XML into the documentation (HTML for the MSDN and VS.NET documenters).
The settings below govern how exactly the XML summary data is merged with the reflected meta-data and therefore govern what items will and will not appear in the final documentation.

member.name: M:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of additional paths to search for reference assemblies.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.ShowMissingSummaries
member.summary: Gets or sets the ShowMissingSummaries property.
member.remarks: If this is true, all members without /doc <summary> comments will contain the phrase Missing Documentation in the generated documentation.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.ShowMissingRemarks
member.summary: Gets or sets the ShowMissingRemarks property.
member.remarks: If this is true, all members without /doc <remarks> comments will contain the phrase Missing Documentation in the generated documentation.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.ShowMissingParams
member.summary: Gets or sets the ShowMissingParams property.
member.remarks: If this is true, all parameters without /doc <param> comments will contain the phrase Missing Documentation in the generated documentation.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.ShowMissingReturns
member.summary: Gets or sets the ShowMissingReturns property.
member.remarks: If this is true, all members without /doc <returns> comments will contain the phrase Missing Documentation in the generated documentation.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.ShowMissingValues
member.summary: Gets or sets the ShowMissingValues property.
member.remarks: If this is true, all properties without /doc <value> comments will contain the phrase Missing Documentation in the generated documentation.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.DocumentInheritedMembers
member.summary: Gets or sets the DocumentInheritedMembers property.
member.remarks: Determines what types of inherited members are documented. Normally, only inherited instance members are documented.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.DocumentInheritedFrameworkMembers
member.summary: Gets or sets the DocumentInheritedFrameworkMembers property.
member.remarks: If true, members inherited from .Net framework classes will be documented.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.DocumentExplicitInterfaceImplementations
member.summary: Gets or sets the DocumentInternals property.
member.remarks: If this is true, members which explicitly implement interfaces will be included in the documentation. Normally, these members are not documented.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.DocumentInternals
member.summary: Gets or sets the DocumentInternals property.
member.remarks: If this is true, types and members marked as internal will be included in the documentation. Normally, internal items are not documented.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.DocumentProtected
member.summary: Gets or sets the DocumentProtected property.
member.remarks: If this is true, protected members will be included in the documentation. Since protected members of non-internal types can be accessed outside of an assembly, this is true by default.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.DocumentSealedProtected
member.summary: Gets or sets the DocumentSealedProtected property.
member.remarks: Turn this flag on to document protected members of sealed classes. DocumentProtected must be turned on, too.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.DocumentPrivates
member.summary: Gets or sets the DocumentPrivates property.

remarks.para: If this is true, types and members marked as private will be included in the documentation.
Normally private items are not documented. This is useful when use NDoc to create documentation intended for internal use.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.DocumentProtectedInternalAsProtected
member.summary: Gets or sets the DocumentProtectedInternalAsProtected property.
member.remarks: If this is true, NDoc will treat "protected internal" members as "protected" only.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.DocumentEmptyNamespaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the DocumentPrivates property.
member.remarks: If this is true, empty namespaces will be included in the documentation. Normally, empty namespaces are not documented.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.SkipNamespacesWithoutSummaries
member.summary: Gets or sets the SkipNamespacesWithoutSummaries property.
member.remarks: Setting this property to true , NDoc will not document namespaces that don't have an associated namespace summary.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.EditorBrowsableFilter
member.summary: Specifies the level of filtering on the EditorBrowsable attribute.

remarks.para: Sets the level of filtering to apply on types/members marked with the EditorBrowsable attribute. Warning: enabling this filter might result in invalid links in the documentation.
As of version 1.3 of NDoc, the <exclude/> tag is the preferred mechanism for suppressing the documentation of types or members.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.AssemblyVersionInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the AssemblyVersion property.
member.remarks: Determines what type of Assembly Version information is documented.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.CopyrightText
member.summary: Gets or sets the CopyrightText property.
member.remarks: A textual copyright notice that will be included with each topic.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.CopyrightHref
member.summary: Gets or sets the CopyrightHref property.
member.remarks: The URI of a copyright notice. A link to this URI will be included with each topic.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.FeedbackEmailAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the FeedbackEmailAddress property.
member.remarks: If an email address is supplied, a mailto link will be placed at the bottom of each page, pointing to this address.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.UseNamespaceDocSummaries
member.summary: Gets or sets the UseNamespaceDocSummaries property.
member.remarks:
If true, the documenter will look for a class with the name NamespaceDoc in each namespace. The summary from that class will then be used as the namespace summary. The class itself will not show up in the resulting documentation output.
You may want to use #if ... #endif together with conditional compilation constants to exclude the NamespaceDoc classes from release build assemblies.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.AutoPropertyBackerSummaries
member.summary: Gets or sets the AutoPropertyBackerSummaries property.
member.remarks: If true, the documenter will automatically add a summary for fields which look like they back (hold the value for) a property. The summary is only added if there is no existing summary, which gives you a way to opt out of this behavior in particular cases. Currently the naming conventions supported are such that fields _Length and length will be inferred to back property Length.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.AutoDocumentConstructors
member.summary: Gets or sets the AutoDocumentConstructors property.
member.remarks: Turning this flag on will enable automatic summary documentation for default constructors. If no summary for a parameter-less constructor is present, the default constructor summary of Initializes a new instance of the CLASSNAME class is inserted.

member.name: P:NDoc.Core.Reflection.BaseReflectionDocumenterConfig.Preliminary
member.summary: Get/set the Preliminary preoperty

remarks.para: If true, NDoc will mark every topic as being preliminary documentation. Each topic will include a notice that the documentation is preliminary
The default notice is [This is preliminary documentation and subject to change.]

member.remarks: Specifies to which version of the .NET Framework SDK documentation the links to system types will be pointing.

member.name: M:NDoc.Core.Project.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Writes an NDoc project to a disk file.
member.remarks:
A project is written to file in a 2 stage process;
The project data is serialised to an in-memory store.
If no errors occured during serialization, the data is written to disk.
This technique ensures that any fatal error during serialization will not cause a a corrupt or incomplete project file to be written to disk.
